phrases.usage: Use this phrase to describe your friend's personality or general character.
phrases.example: My friend is very kind and helpful to everyone.

phrases.usage: Use this to give a physical description of your friend's hair.
phrases.example: She has long brown hair and a very nice smile.

phrases.usage: Use this when you want to describe a specific facial feature.
phrases.example: He wears glasses when he reads books at the library.

phrases.usage: Use this to describe your friend's height to another person.
phrases.example: She is tall and she likes to play basketball often.

phrases.usage: Use this to answer a question about your friend's specific job.
phrases.example: He works as a teacher at the local primary school.

phrases.usage: Use this to explain the general place or industry of work.
phrases.example: She works in a large office in the city center.

phrases.usage: Use this to mention that your friend lives close to you.
phrases.example: He lives nearby so we see each other every weekend.

phrases.usage: Use this to talk about your friend's favorite hobbies or interests.
phrases.example: She likes listening to pop music in her free time.

keyVocabulary.definition: Being very nice and helpful to other people.
Being pleasant and easy to talk to other people.
Having many new and interesting ideas to share.
Having a lot of work or things to do.
Ready to give help to those who need it.
